alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar a large area of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Ritter northeast through Ladson, Summerville, North Charleston to near Cordesville. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has already fallen in this area. With the potential for another 1 to 2 inches of rain to fall through 8 PM, there will be an increased risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Cottageville, Knightsville, Delemar Crossroads, Jedburg, Givhans, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, College Park and Crowfield Plantation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
